page.title: 05 BETLEY CHURCH
page.content: St.Margaret's Church is probably the most historic building in this area. It was built in 1185 AD and it is celebrating it's 700th centenery this year although the present building was built in the 16th century.Rev.John Whitehead is the present vicar but he has only recently taken over from Rev. Henry Armstrong who has now retired. The church has a choir of its own who perform at weddings,funerals etc.The actual building is timber framed with lead and tiled roofs. Along either side of the nave are 8 octagonal pillars made of Spanish Chestnut. There is a graveyard around the church with an extension across the road. There is said to be a ghost in the church but there are no recorded sightings.There is a clock on the Bell Tower in memory of Charles Fletcher Twemlow.It was installed in 1967.
